Vaughn graduated cum laude in 1968 before he became a teacher in Greenville County. He served as the president of both the Greenville County Association of Teachers and the South Carolina Education Association. "Today is a testament that, while no longer here, Joseph\'s work of equality and inspiring others to reach their full potential continues now and for the years to come," Marcus Tate, a cousin of Vaughn\'s, told the crowd. "My family and I are deeply touched by everybody instrumental in making today possible."
